CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant suffered a whiplash injury to her neck as a result of a traffic accident . Her insurance company P. paid her a disability allowance until DATE . In DATE the insurance company refused her a further allowance , considering her continuing disability to be caused by other physical illnesses from which she had been suffering prior to the accident . ORG ( tapaturmalautakunta , olycksfallsnämnden ) rejected her appeal . Her further appeal to ORG ( vakuutusoikeus , försäkringsdomstolen ) was rejected in DATE and ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) refused her leave to appeal in DATE .

CARDINAL . Subsequently the applicant again applied to her insurance company for a disability allowance , now relying on a medical report of DATE concluding that she remained unable to work . This request was rejected in DATE , the insurance company essentially having found that her medical condition had remained unchanged since ORG decision of DATE . The applicant ’s appeal was rejected by ORG in DATE after it had requested an opinion from the insurance company . This opinion was not communicated to the applicant but the company ’s views were reproduced in the decision .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s further appeal was rejected by ORG on DATE after it had obtained a fresh opinion from the insurance company . This opinion , concluding in a proposal that the appeal be rejected , was not communicated to the applicant . Nor was it reproduced or summarised in the ORG decision .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant ’s insurance company ORG rejected her request for a disability pension , having found that she was not disabled within the meaning of the legislation on employment - based pensions . Her appeal to ORG ( eläkelautakunta , pensionsnämnden ) was rejected . Her further appeal to ORG was rejected in DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The insurance company rejected the applicant ’s renewed pension request in DATE , referring to its previous decision and finding that the new evidence adduced did not warrant any change in the insurance company ’s position . Her appeal to ORG was rejected in DATE after it had obtained an opinion from the insurance company . This opinion proposing that the appeal be rejected was not communicated to the applicant , nor was it reproduced or summarised in ORG decision .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed further to ORG which also requested an opinion from the insurance company . This opinion , again proposing that the appeal be rejected , was not communicated to the applicant . Nor was it reproduced or summarised in the ORG decision of DATE by which her appeal was rejected . ORG considered , in light of the evidence adduced , that the applicant ’s ability to work was not so reduced as to render her eligible for an employment - based disability pension .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s request for a national disability pension was rejected by ORG ( kansaneläkelaitos , folkpensionsanstalten ) in DATE . It found that , although she was still suffering from symptoms caused by her neck injury , her headaches and other symptoms as well as her depression , they were not causing her such inconvenience as to render her incapable of continuing her work as a laboratory assistant when no longer eligible for a DATE allowance under the national health insurance scheme . Her appeal to ORG ( tarkastuslautakunta , prövningsnämnden ; “ the ORG ” ) was rejected in DATE and her further appeal to ORG was rejected in DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s renewed request for a national disability pension was rejected by ORG on DATE . It found that she was still suffering from neck and shoulder pain , stiffness , aches , depression and insomnia . Her ability to function physically was nonetheless satisfactory . Given her overall state of health , she was able to continue working as a laboratory assistant or performing similar tasks . Accordingly , she could not be regarded as disabled within the meaning of LAW ( kansaneläkelaki , folkpensionslagen CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s appeal to ORG was rejected on DATE after it had requested an opinion from ORG . This opinion was not communicated to the applicant nor was it reproduced or summarised in ORG decision . ORG considered , in light of all medical and other evidence , that the applicant was not to be regarded as disabled within the meaning of LAW .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed further to ORG , adducing further medical reports . ORG obtained an opinion from ORG which was dated DATE and concluded in a proposal that the appeal should be rejected . This opinion was not communicated to the applicant , nor was it reproduced or summarised in the ORG decision of DATE by which her appeal was rejected . ORG referred to the reasons invoked in ORG decision and found that the fresh evidence submitted did not call for any change in the assessment of the applicant ’s ability to work .

CARDINAL . At the relevant time ORG applied mainly the principles derived from the rules of procedure of the courts of appeal . Insofar as relevant , LAW provided as follows . According to LAW , sections CARDINAL , the opposing party was to be heard in proceedings before appellate courts . According to LAW , section DATE , subsection CARDINAL , a copy of the observations of the opposing party was to be forwarded to the appellant on request . According to LAW , section CARDINAL , the court of appeal was to request written observations from the parties when it obtained evidence on its own initiative and such evidence could affect the decision in the case , unless such hearing of the parties was manifestly unnecessary .

CARDINAL . From DATE onwards ORG has been applying LAW ( hallintolainkäyttölaki , förvaltningsprocesslagen ORG ) except with regard to extraordinary proceedings , in respect of which special rules apply ( section CARDINAL of the Act on ORG , as amended by Act no . CARDINAL ) .
